file

Class FileHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • file.FileHandler

  • public class FileHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    8-4-15 Class for handling file transfers between clients.
    Author:
    Tristan de Boer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int MAX_DATA_LENGTH
      The maximum length of the data contained in the packet.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileHandler()
      The maximum size of the data that can be added to a data packet.

    • Method Detail

      • addHeaders

        public java.util.List<byte[]> addHeaders(java.util.List<byte[]> dataArray,
                                int filenumber)
        Adds headers to a List of byte-arrays (to keep them in order and check if they all are available) and returns the new list.
        Parameters:
        dataArray - List of data-arrays on which the headers will be added.
        filenumber - Unique ID of the file.
        Returns:
        The old list, but now with headers! :D

      • removeHeaders

        public java.util.List<byte[]> removeHeaders(java.util.List<byte[]> headerArray)
        Removes the headers from an List of byte-arrays and returns this list.
        Parameters:
        headerArray - A list of byte-arrays with headers.
        Returns:
        The list without headers.

      • openFile

        public byte[] openFile(java.nio.file.Path file)
        Opens a file from path and returns the byte array of the file
        Parameters:
        file - The absolute path to the file.
        Returns:
        A byte array of the file.

      • writeFile

        public void writeFile(byte[] listdata,
             java.lang.String filename)
        Writes data to a filename in a PenguinDir.
        Parameters:
        listdata - The data that has to be written
        filename - The filename

      • createDir

        private boolean createDir(java.io.File filename)
        Create PenguinDir (if not exists).
        Parameters:
        filename - The directory. (In this case only Penguin is used).
        Returns:
        True if the directory has been created or if the directory already exists.

        Returns:

      • getTotalPackets

        public int getTotalPackets(byte[] data)
        Returns the total amount of packets to be expected for this file.
        Parameters:
        data - The byte-array witch is file-data.
        Returns:
